required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dual-target CAR-T Cells (C-4-29) in the Treatment of Relapsed/Refractory Multiple Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I Clinical Study of CAR-T Cells (C-4-29) in the Treatment of Patients With Relapsed/Refractory Multiple Myeloma

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase I clinical study to evaluate the safety and tolerability of C-4-29 in patients with relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma, and to obtain the maximum tolerated dose of C-4-29 and phase II Recommended dose.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a multi-center, single-arm, open-label study. The study plans to set up 3 dose groups, adopting a dose-escalating 3+3 design, and plan to recruit about 9-18 subjects with relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma.C-4-29 cells will be infused to the subject by intravenous infusion.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Adverse events after C-4-29 infusion [Safety and Tolerability]
primary_outcome.description: Therapy-related adverse events were recorded and assessed according to the National Cancer Institute's Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE, Version 5.0)

primary_outcome.measure: Obtain the maximum tolerated dose of C-4-29 cells[Safety and Tolerability]

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective response rate after C-4-29 infusion [Effectiveness]
secondary_outcome.description: Objective response rate includes sCR, CR, VGPR, PR, MR
AUCS is defined as the area under the curve in 28 days
CMAX is defined as the highest concentration of C-4-29 cells expanded in peripheral blood
TMAX is defined as the time to reach the highest concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: Peripheral blood M protein contents after C-4-29 infusion [Cell dynamics]
secondary_outcome.description: Periodic detection of Peripheral blood M protein after cell infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Urine Bence-Jones protein contents after C-4-29 infusion [Cell dynamics]
secondary_outcome.description: Periodic detection of Urine Bence-Jones protein after cell infusion

other_outcome.description: OS is defined as the time from C-4-29 cell infusion to death due to any cause
PFS is defined as the time from the start of the C-4-29 infusion to the first disease progression or death from any cause

other_outcome.measure: Duration of relief after C-4-29 infusion
other_outcome.description: DOR is defined as the time from reaching MR or better to disease progression or death from any cause

arm_group.description: Infusion of C-4-29 cells by dose-escalating

intervention.description: Drug: C-4-29 Cells； Administration method: intravenous infusion； Subjects will be treated with Fludarabine and Cyclophosphamide before cell infusion.

facility.name: Union Hospital, Tongji Medical College, Huazhong University of Science and Technology
